name: Aloe Vera
careinstructions: A beautiful, popular and low maintenance succulent. It's best to leave this plant alone for the most part, as overwatering is typically more damaging than underwatering. Requires cactusspecific soil blends. Container size is unimporant.  The small tap root grows well in large or small containers. Fertilizer or plant food is rarely necessary for an Aloe Vera to thrive. Aloe, when healthy, does tend to produce lots of new leaves.  It can be necessary to trim off the unhealthy or dead leaves. To do this, use a sterilized knife and carefully cut the base of the leaf, paying special attention to not damage healthy leaves.
